explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: No data available. The flash point of some products on the market is 63degC (c.c.) (14102 chemical product), which can be classified into Category 4.

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: No data available, though containing unsaturated bonds. Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#3302) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#3302) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#3302) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 455mg/kg representing the lowest fixed value of the testing data, 455mg/kg, 1,200-1,500mg/kg, 215-681mg/kg, and 533mg/kg (SIDS (2003)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of 419mg/kg representing the lower value of two testing data, 419mg/kg and 891mg/kg (SIDS (2003)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on the LC50 value (4 hours) of 11ppm, calculated from the testing data of rat LC50 (inhalation of vapour) of 0.066mg/L (SIDS (2003)), 0.972mg/L, (1 hour) (SIDS (2003)), 0.22mg/L (4 hours) (SIDS (2003)), was lower than 90% of the saturated vapour concentration (670ppm) under a saturated vapour pressure of 68Pa (20degC) (IUCLID (2000)), the substance was considered as "vapour containing substantially no mist" and was classified based on standard values expressed in ppm.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of skin corrosivity from the rabbit primary skin irritation tests (three reports in SIDS (2003)) and lack of data for subclassification, although the substance should be placed in Category 1A from the viewpoint of safety.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Two reports are available on rabbit primary conjunctiva irritation tests (SIDS (2003)), the results of which serve as a basis for classification into Category 2 (Severely Irritating) and Category 1 (Corrosive). However, the test conditions are not specified.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitizer: Classification not possible Skin sensitizer: Category 1
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitizer: No data available Skin sensitizer: Based on the positive results of guinea pig skin sensitization tests based on the modified Magnusson and Kligman Maximization method, described in SIDS (2003).

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of positive data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests and germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, and negative data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, described in CERI Hazard Data 2001-27 (2002).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Based on the description in SIDS (2003): Malformations are observed in the embryo, none of which can be indirectly attributed to maternal toxicity.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "restlessness, sedation, piloerection, tremor, coma, gasping respiration, hyperpnea, dyspnea, rhonchus" (CERI Hazard Data 2001-27 (2002)), "a decrease in mobility, sedation, piloerection, dyspnea, tonic clonic spasm, pulmonary edema (observed primarily in dying specimens)" (SIDS (2003)). The effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure

aspiration_hazard.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "alveolar hemorrhage (due probably to irritation caused by the reflux of the orally administered substance), pulmonary edema/congestion, fatal cases" (SIDS (2003)). The kinematic viscosity stands at 1.31mm2/s (25degC) (CERI calculated value (2005)).

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 72 hours ErC50=0.88mg/L of the algae (Scenedesmus) (SIDS, 2004).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since there was rapidly degrading (it was hydrolyzed to acrylic acid (the decomposition by BOD: 67.8%) and to N,N-dimethylethanolamine (the decomposition by BOD: 60.5%) (Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)) and the bio-accumulation was low (log Kow=0.42 (PHYSPROP Database (2005))), it was claasified into Not classified.
